resources.string:
Beaus lines are indentations that run across the nails. The indentations can appear when growth at the area under the cuticle is interrupted by injury or severe illness.
 
		Conditions associated with Beaus lines include uncontrolled diabetes and peripheral vascular disease, as well as illnesses associated with a high fever, such as scarlet fever, measles, mumps and pneumonia. Beaus lines can also be a sign of zinc deficiency.

Nail clubbing occurs when the tips of the fingers enlarge and the nails curve around the fingertips, usually over the course of years.
 
		Nail clubbing is sometimes the result of low oxygen in the blood and could be a sign of various types of lung disease. Nail clubbing is also associated with inflammatory bowel disease, cardiovascular disease, liver disease and AIDS.

Spoon-shaped or spooning fingernails refers to a concavity in the fingernail itself, resulting in a depression in the nail that gives an appearance of a spoon shape to the entire nail. This growth disturbance in the nail is medically known as koilonychia. The spooning is typically such that a water droplet may be placed and held in the depression within the nail.
 
		This pattern can sometimes be seen in normal infants, but it disappears as the child ages. Koilonychia is a component of the nail-patella syndrome, a genetic disease characterized by numerous abnormalities including musculoskeletal and kidney abnormalities.Spooning fingernails can also result from trauma, exposure to certain solvents, or it may be associated with chronic medical conditions. In particular, koilonychias is associated with iron deficiency.

With the condition known as Terrys nails, most of the nails appear white except for a narrow pink band at the tip.
 
		Terrys nails can sometimes be attributed to aging. In other cases, Terrys nails can be a sign of a serious underlying condition, such as liver disease, congestive heart failure, kidney failure or diabetes.

With yellow nail syndrome, nails thicken and new growth slows. This results in a yellowish discoloration of the nails.
 
		Nails affected by yellow nail syndrome might lack a cuticle and detach from the nail bed in places. Yellow nail syndrome is often a sign of respiratory disease, such as chronic bronchitis. Yellow nail syndrome can also be related to swelling of the hands (lymphedema).
\t\tBionyx is an application that captures fingernail images to analyze nail color and patterns for possible disease identification.\n
\t\tThere should be an ADEQUATE LIGHTING. Sunlight or daylight is the preferred source. PREVENT capturing images with glare.\n
\t\tAll nail polish, lacquer or other topical substances should be REMOVED.\n
\t\tThe surface of the fingernail should be CLEANSED with solution such as alcohol or acetone.\n
When taking picture, the patientâ€™s finger should be RELAXED and not pressed HARDLY against any surface.
\tTap the TAKE PICTURE button to capture fingernail image. When taking fingernail image, MAKE SURE TO FOCUS THE CAMERA TO THE FINGERNAIL SURFACE. \n
\tCROP the image of the fingernail\'s surface and ensure that the fingernail\'s image orientation is horizontally upward.\n
\t\tTap the PROCESS button to process the fingernail image and wait for the result.\n

This procedure is similar to other laboratory tests that are requested by physicians. It is meant to help assist in arriving at an impression or a diagnosis; however, the final disposition of the patient remains with the doctor. Whatever result this app shows, it is still best to consult a physician.\n

Note : This procedure is similar to other laboratory tests that are requested by physicians. It is meant to help assist in arriving at an impression or a diagnosis; however, the final disposition of the patient remains with the doctor. Whatever result this app shows, it is still best to consult a physician.\n
\t\tAny images aside from fingernail image is PROHIBITED. INJURED and PAINTED fingernail is also PROHIBITED since it may alter the result of the prognosis.\n
\t\tIt is preferred to use WHITE BACKGROUND when taking fingernail image.\n
\t\tMake sure that the mobile phone is CONNECTED TO THE INTERNET to process the image and have result of prognosis.\n
\t\tThere should be an ADEQUATE LIGHTING. Sunlight or daylight is the preferred source. PREVENT detecting images with glare.\n
\t Ensure that the fingernail\'s orientation of the user is HORIZONTALLY UPWARD.\n
\t Wait until the camera is FOCUSED on the fingernail of the user to be able to detect properly\n
\t\tIt is preferred to use WHITE BACKGROUND when using real-time detection of fingernail.\n

\t\tThe Real-time feature of the application gives possible diseases associated to the detected nail disorder. However, the result of the real-time feature is NOT RECORDED to the history of the application\n
Tap TAKE PICTURE button to capture fingernail image, CROP image, ALIGN fingernail horizontally upward and tap PROCESS button and wait for the result.

1.) When taking picture, the patient's should be RELAXED and not pressed HARDLY against any surface.
 
2.) It is preferred to use WHITE BACKGROUND when taking fingernail image.
 
3.) Tap the TAKE PICTURE button to capture fingernail image. When taking fingernail image, MAKE SURE TO FOCUS THE CAMERA TO THE FINGERNAIL SURFACE
 
4.) CROP the image of the fingernail's surface and ensure that the fingernail's image orientation is HORIZONTALLY UPWARD.
 
5.) Tap PROCESS button and wait for the result.
This device doesn\'t support Camera2 API.
